content.question: The work shown, attributed to Cotsiogo (Cadzi Cody), can be interpreted as an art form that affirms Eastern Shoshone identity because it was

choices.label: sold to tourists to help support members of the artistâ€™s tribe
worn by an Eastern Shoshone chief or accomplished warrior
painted on an animal hide using natural pigments and stencils
composed of motifs commonly found on traditional Puebloan pottery

content.answer: painted on an animal hide using natural pigments and stencils

topic.text: 5.4: Theories and Interpretations of Indigenous American Art

skill.text: Skill 7.B: Explain how one or more art historically valid interpretations of a work of art (or group of related works of art) are derived from an analysis of its form, style, materials, content, function, context, reception, and/or meaning.
